SENT.plain: The differential diagnosis of oral ulcerations in a patient with AIDS/HIV infection is often challenging to the clinician
While old diseases have appeared in a new garb, many new ones are also being recognized
The association of Behetaet's disease and AIDS/HIV infection has been recently recognized
We present an HIV-positive patient having oro-genital aphthosis conforming to the diagnostic criteria for Behetaet's disease
Erythema nodosum, periphlebitis, erythematous papulopustular lesions, half and half nails, ocular congestion, raised ESR and dimorphic anemia were some other features present
He had no other HIV-related disease
He responded well to triple anti-retroviral treatment alone
The possible pathomechanism of the occurrence of both diseases is also discussed
